title: How to Reset a Nintendo DS Lite

steps.title: Understand what a soft reset does.
steps.content: Understand what a soft reset does. Doing a soft reset may be required when the system hangs or crashes. This way does not delete your settings as a hard reset does

steps.title: Go to the side of the DS where the power switch is located.
steps.content: Go to the side of the DS where the power switch is located.

steps.title: Push it upward and the screen should turn off.
steps.content: Push it upward and the screen should turn off.

steps.title: Turn the system back on by pushing the power switch upward.
steps.content: Turn the system back on by pushing the power switch upward. You're done and you should be able to use the DS Lite as normal.

steps.title: Understand what a hard reset does.
steps.content: Understand what a hard reset does. A hard reset will erase all of your settings and will make you set it up like you bought it brand new.This method only erases the settings data and will not erase any gamecard info

steps.title: Power the system off and remove any cartridges in Slot-1(DS game port) and Slot-2 (Game Boy Advance cartridge port).
steps.content: Power the system off and remove any cartridges in Slot-1(DS game port) and Slot-2 (Game Boy Advance cartridge port).

steps.title: Flip over the system.
steps.content: Flip over the system. Using a Philips Head Screwdriver (#00), unscrew the cover that holds the battery.

steps.title: Remove the battery from the system and wait 5 seconds.
steps.content: Remove the battery from the system and wait 5 seconds.

steps.title: Re-insert the battery into the battery port and replace the cover.
steps.content: Re-insert the battery into the battery port and replace the cover.

steps.title: Power the DS Lite on.
steps.content: Power the DS Lite on. It should tell you that you need to set the system up. Then you're done!
